intro: Cienfuegosia heterophylla subsp. subternata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cienfuegosia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its alternate, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
